original: Asplöf, Herman Natanael, domkyrkoorganist, Göteborg, f. 15/11/81 i Gåsborn, Värml. 1., av folksk där. Carl A. o. Emma Svanberg. G. m. Wen-dela Ebba Wilhelmina Skytte. Barn: Britta f. 12, Iwa 20, Ulla 24. — Stud. v. musikkons. 98-03, organist-, musiklär:- o. kyrkosång :ex. där, tillika stud. i pianospel o. komp. Organist i S:t Petri förs. i Malmö 09-10, i Gbgs Annedal 10 o. v. Gustavi domkyrkoförs. i Gbg sed. 29, tillika lär. v. MA kurser f. kyrkomusiker, musiklär. v. Ma-jornas h. a. 1. samt examinator v. or-ganistex. i Gbg. Har bl. a. komp. pianokonsert, konsertstycke f. orgel o. orkester. Dialog f. orgel o. orkester, smärre stycken f. orgel samt kör-komp. TilM. statens tonsättarstip. 26. RVO, Mus. akad. o. P. A. Bergs jeton.
translated: Asplöf, Herman Natanael, cathedral organist, Gothenburg, born November 15, 1881 in Gåsborn, Värmland. Son of the primary school teachers Carl A. and Emma Svanberg. Married to Wendela Ebba Wilhelmina Skytte. Children: Britta born 1912, Iwa born 1920, Ulla born 1924. Studied at the music conservatory from 1898 to 1903, obtained certificates in organ playing, music teaching and church choir singing, also studied piano playing and composition. Organist at St. Petri church in Malmö from 1909 to 1910, at Annedal church in Gothenburg in 1910, and at Gustavi cathedral parish in Gothenburg since 1929. He also teaches musical courses for church musicians, teaches music at Majorna's high school and examines organist exams in Gothenburg. He has composed several works, including a piano concerto, a concert piece for organ and orchestra, a dialogue for organ and orchestra, smaller pieces for organ, and choir compositions. Received a state composer scholarship in 1926. Honors include the Royal Order of the Vasa, membership in the Swedish Academy of Music and P. A. Berg's jeton.

award.name: The Royal Order of the Vasa
